proxy

Class ClientCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • proxy.ClientCommunicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICommunicator

    public class ClientCommunicator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICommunicator
    Class Used for communicating with the server. It runs all the various game commands and communicates results back to the proxy
    Author:
    Chad

      • executeCommand

        public CommandResponse executeCommand(RequestType requestType,
                             java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> headers,
                             java.lang.String commandName,
                             java.lang.Object commandParameters,
                             java.lang.Class<?> responseCastClass)
        Starts the request from the server given the information from the proxy. Starts by packaging up the info and having the translator change it to json. Then takes the json object with the request type and sends it to the server.
        Specified by:
        executeCommand in interface ICommunicator
        Parameters:
        commandName - the type of command to be carried out on the server
        commandParameters - the object to be sent to the server
        headers - the given cookie data
        requestType - what is expected back object wise
        responseCastClass - what the translator needs to get the right object back
        Returns:
        ICommandResponse from the server
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        Precondition:
        A list of headers most be put together, plus all the other necessary information for boxing up a package to be sent to the server
        Postcondition:
        If all conditions are right, and execution is normal, A commandResponse object packaged up with all necessary data is sent back to proxy.
